p: Despite the growing interest in pharmacologically active phytochemicals sourced Dendropanax species, as far as we know, only a few studies considering the phytochemical and pharmacological features of this genus plant species have been conducted to date. The Dendropanax genus has been shown to contain polyphenols, flavonoids, tannins, pyrimidines, essential oils, terpenoids, phenol carboxylic acids, and alkaloids. From the available literature, the species D. morbifera has been the most-widely investigated, although D. dentiger, D. arboreus, D. chevalieri, D. proteus, and D. querceti have also been examined. In recent decades, the phytochemical and main bioactive compounds of D. morbifera [ 47, 48, 49, 50, 51, 52] ( Table 1 and Table 2) and other species of the Dendropanax genus have been studied ( Tables S1 and S2).
